algo.name: gcd-query-v1
algo.desc:
skittles1412
I wonder if this program leaks enough information for you to get the flag with less than 2048 queries... It probably does. I'm sure you can figure out how.

algo.name: gcd-query-v2
algo.desc:
hellopir
I thought that skittles1412's querying system wasn't optimized enough, so I created my own. My system is so much more optimized than his!

algo.name: whiteboard
algo.desc:
skittles1412
Bryan Gao has gotten into the habit of starting with some numbers on the whiteboard, and then writing down the result of applying a function on a set of the numbers on the whiteboard on the whiteboard. See if you're skilled enough at this to achieve flag!

crypto.name: Compact XORs
crypto.desc:
skittles1412
I found some hex in a file called fleg, but I'm not sure how it's encoded. I'm pretty sure it's some kind of xor...

crypto.name: Excuse me
crypto.desc:
flocto
Uhhh I found this random text on the ground.

crypto.name: Lottery
crypto.desc:
hellopir2
Yeah so I made a flag lottery. Draw 3 times to get the flag... wait. I forgot I encrypted the flag. Eh, I'm sure you can figure that out yourself. Good luck!

crypto.name: Minimalaestic
crypto.desc:
hellopir2
You know how aes is supposed to be like good at encrypting and like fast and stuff? What if i like inverted all of that and then like you know made it take forever to run and then make it really bad at encrypting...

crypto.name: Non-Quadratic Residues
crypto.desc:
hellopir2
I realized the flaw in my previous system, so now I'll patch it up using my new foolproof system. What previous system? I have no idea but maybe there used to be one??? I still think there's no way you're stealing my flag!

crypto.name: OwO time pad
crypto.desc:
hellopir2
One time pad best cipher. It's unbreakable! Hmm what's the point of it if I have to give you the key though...?

crypto.name: Poly Fractions
crypto.desc:
hellopir2
I "lost" my flag in the coefficients of a rational expression, could you help recover it?

crypto.name: The Vault 2
crypto.desc:
hellopir2
I remember this cool HSCTF-22 challenge that gave you like an admin key or something and then made you find bigger solutions. Well this time I'm not giving you an admin key. Good luck!

crypto.name: Weak Primes
crypto.desc:
hellopir2
I know having p and q be too close together is insecure, but surely my innovative prime generation method is secure. I can't see why it isn't.

crypto.name: You get extra information 2
crypto.desc:
hellopir2
You get more information! More complicated = more information right.

crypto.name: lce cream generator
crypto.desc:
hellopir2
Ice cream. Or wait... lce cream. Same difference.

misc.name: Censorship
misc.desc:
hellopir2 and flocto
I'll let you run anything on my python program as long as you don't try to print the flag or violate any of my other rules! Pesky CTFers...

misc.name: Censorship Lite
misc.desc:
hellopir2 and flocto
There was clearly not enough censorship last time. This time it's lite:tm:. I'm afraid now you'll never get in to my system! Unfortunate for those pesky CTFers. Better social engineer an admin for the flag!!!!

misc.name: guessctf
misc.desc:
hellopir2
I thought there wasn't enough guessing on this CTF, so I added some. All necessary hints are provided within the given file. Good luck! Only the last level solved gives points. This challenge is just for fun.
Note:
The flocto hint counter is cumulative. Thanks to flocto for testing this challenge and adding feedback for the challenges on the guessier side.
Note:
I added 17 more levels. Good luck have fun.

misc.name: q-CHeSHires game
misc.desc:
flocto
A friendly cat approaches you with an interesting game. If you can win enough times, maybe it'll give you the flag?
This challenge was done on Qiskit version 0.42.1. See template.py for an example of server interaction.

misc.name: q-warmup
misc.desc:
flocto
If a bit flips and no one is around to observe it, does it still cause a bug?
This challenge was done on Qiskit version 0.42.1.

pwn.name: ELFcrafting-v1
pwn.desc:
unvariant
How well do you understand the ELF file format?

pwn.name: ELFcrafting-v2
pwn.desc:
unvariant
The smallest possible 64 bit ELF is 80 bytes. Can you golf it down to 79 bytes?

pwn.name: frog-math
pwn.desc:
unvariant
We found this legacy code on our disk that still uses mmx and x87 smh. Can you help us test it for any bugs?

pwn.name: hex-converter-2
pwn.desc:
stuxf
Unvariant took a look at my hex-converter. Because he's a pwn god, he pwned it. So this time, I made it print in reverse order so you can't go backwards in the stack!

pwn.name: hex-converter
pwn.desc:
stephen
I kept on getting my hex mixed up while trying to solve unvariant's pwn challenges, so I wrote my own converter to help me out.
Hint: What's in the stack that we can overwrite?

pwn.name: i-love-ffi
pwn.desc:
unvariant
I love ffi, don't you?

pwn.name: perfect-sandbox
pwn.desc:
unvariant
1 solve / 
This is a perfect sandbox with absolutely no way to leak the flag!
You should probably read https://arxiv.org/pdf/2304.07940.pdf or https://gruss.cc/files/prefetch.pdf.

pwn.name: permissions
pwn.desc:
unvariant
Every programmer should read the Intel Software Developer Manuals at least once.

pwn.name: rntk
pwn.desc:
voxal
check out my random number toolkit!

pwn.name: simple-heap-v1
pwn.desc:
unvariant
Nothing to see here. Just a regular heap chall.

pwn.name: simpleOS
pwn.desc:
unvariant
If you were hoping that this would be some kernel pwn I'm afraid that you'll be disappointed...
I wanted an excuse to write something in zig, so here we are!


# simpleOS

To build locally, run `sudo make build`. This will generate a `disk.img` file that can be run in qemu. Use `run-local.sh` to test solves
locally as there will be a long pow on the server.

rev.name: CSCE221-Data Structures and Algorithms
rev.desc:
flocto
I was doing some homework for my Data Structures and Algorithms class, but my program unexpectedly crashed when I entered in my flag. Could you help me get it back?
Here's the coredump and the binary, I'll even toss in the header file. Can't give out the source code though, how do I know you won't cheat off me?

rev.name: emojis
rev.desc:
flocto
I apologize in advance. Flag is amateursCTF{[a-z0-9_]+} Compiled using the latest version of emojicode

rev.name: flagchecker
rev.desc:
flocto, hellopir2
I was making this simple flag checker in Scratch, but my friend logged into my account and messed up all my variable names :(. Can you help me recover my flag please?
You should run on Turbowarp for better performance.

rev.name: headache
jvm
rev.desc:
flocto
I heard my professor talking about some "Java Virtual Machine" and its weird gimmicks, so I took it upon myself to complete one. It wasn't even that hard? I don't know why he was complaining about it so much.
Compiled with openjdk 11.0.19.
Run with java JVM code.jvm.

rev.name: rusteze
rusteze 2
trick question
rev.desc:
flocto
Which one do you hate more: decompiling pycs or reading Python bytecode disassembly? Just kidding that's a trick question.
Run with Python version 3.10.
Flag is amateursCTF{[a-zA-Z0-9_]+}

web.name: cps remastered
web.desc:
voxal
Check out my CPS test! I made sure to sanitize my SQL queries (well except for the register page, but since that one is an insert, you can't really do anything), and I'm so confident that you won't get my admin password that I'll leak the first 5 characters of it!
Note: this challenge is worth zero points due to solve script being accidentally provided. It is available for practice and fun purposes only.

web.name: funny factorials
web.desc:
stuxf
I made a factorials app! It's so fancy and shmancy. However factorials don't seem to properly compute at big numbers! Can you help me fix it?

web.name: go-gopher
web.desc:
voxal
psst... i know flag sharing isn't allowed, and i found this page where someone seems to be recieving flags from someone else. can you somehow find a way to hijack this site so it gives me flags? thanks.

web.name: gophers-revenge
web.desc:
voxal
you guys are going to regret ever crossing me.

web.name: lahoot
web.desc:
smashmaster
Recently Kahoot decided to limit players to 10 if you don't pay a subscription fee. Since I'm broke, I decided to write my own self-hosted version Kahoot-style game. idk why but my friend thinks the code is a bit cursed.


# Lahoot
Self-hosted Kahoot clone intended for running one game at a time. 
## Installing
If you are on a version of node that is not 16 you might need to `--force` node into installing friendly-words or rewrite the friendly name generator. 
## Flavor
Admins can put their own files into `flavor` to allow for custom sfx. 
## Locking
We use Postgres to lock our async code.

web.name: sanity
web.desc:
voxal
check out this pastebin! its a great way to store pieces of your sanity between ctfs.

web.name: uwuctf
web.desc:
smashmaster
this rust uwuifier is so fast i'm sure it's going to scale to the moon as long as i can dupe my nodes. uwuifier as a service pro subscription when?
update: the zip is nearly the same as the server except we removed the challenge.yml and flag.txt


you're so lucky I compiled the uwufier for you :)
normally it requires installing rust
